answer: ITS students should prepare several things before participating in a study abroad program, including documentation, financial arrangements, belongings, knowledge, and psychology. Specific preparations may vary depending on the type of program they are participating in, such as exchange programs, internships, or short programs. Some general important documents to prepare include a passport, certificate of English proficiency, official academic transcript in English, certificate of enrollment, learning agreement, statement letter, recommendation letter in English, funding request assistance (optional), and GCW (Global Competencies Workshop) non-degree test or certificate. Additionally, students should check the requirements of the specific program they are interested in, fill out a learning agreement or statement letter, select courses to be transferred, and submit all required documents to the ITS Global Engagement office. Students can find available international programs to join through the ITS Global Engagement website or social media channels.
